alert.note: Alert for Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 9:58AM EDT until May 19 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following county, Onslow. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, North Topsail Beach, New River Station, Camp Lejeune Center, Pumpkin Center, Piney Green, Half Moon, Swansboro, Hubert, Verona, Midway Park, Dixon, Kellum, Folkstone, Catherine Lake, Silverdale, Hammocks Beach, Onslow Beach, Sneads Ferry and Sea View Pier. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
